DIRECTOR OF ENGINEERING

Successful implementations of lean factory methodology

configuration management, data analytics, and business intelligence. Skilled at mixed model, cellular
production, lean factory, data-driven KPI's, for electromechanical manufacturing, with progressive increase in
leadership responsibility and a proven record of culture turnaround and team performance

piece flow, reducing quality defects 95% YOY, all in 1/3 the same space. Customer Service quality level defects down from 65% to below 1%, developing real-time KPI's with

<JD_START>
Job Title: National Accounts Manager – Industrial - Remote

Location: Decatur, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
BioSolutions Division, Carbohydrates Solutions

This is a full time, exempt level position.

The successful candidate will be a dynamic and results driven sales professional with a proven track record in developing new business within the Industrial sector. The role requires strong communication and interpersonal skills, strategic thinking and a relentless drive for achieving sales targets. This position will be responsible for hunting new business in multiple subsegments including coatings and adhesives, mining, renewable chemicals, water treatment and exploring areas that are looking for sustainable solutions to replace petrochemicals. Accounts once brought into the business will also be need to managed and nurtured. Our general industrial segment is one of the six key segments for the BioSolutions business, which is focused on bringing sustainable solutions to the industrial marketplace. The other five key segments in this business are Sustainable Paper & Packaging, Fermentation, Plant Health, Construction and Consumer Care.

Desired Characteristics

 5+ years of Industrial Sales experience  Entrepreneurial mindset, strong hunter mentality with strong desire to develop and own relationships  Demonstrated success in developing and implementing new business strategies, resulting in revenue growth  Resourceful, self-starter with strong interpersonal skills  Ability to work as a team player in a growing, quickly-changing business environment  Proven service and customer focus with ability to build customer relationships across all levels of management, purchasing, marketing, R&D and plant personnel  Demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects and report developments to cross functional teams  Willingness to learn, assist and manage all customer channels and products  Desire/motivation to help promote other ADM products to “key” relationships 

Essential Responsibilities

 Work closely with our customer facing organization to develop and implement differentiated value propositions for our customers  Develop new sales for our general Industrial business in North America  Be recognized customer expert and key point of contact for ADM Carbohydrate Solutions portfolio that includes dextrose, fructose, glucose syrups, maltodextrin, corn starch, corn steep liquor, citric acid and derivatives  Recommends Specialty “value-added” solutions, including but not limited to new products, technologies, andprocesses to obtain new business in support of Fermentation segment growth targets  Facilitate and drive discovery meetings with new prospects, understanding applications and customer needs  Continually draws insights on customer needs and seeks opportunities to translate these into actionable plans and new sales development  Develops and maintains a strong working knowledge of the markets and competitive landscape  Develop targeted customer lists in collaboration with Industrial Segment Leader and Sales Director  Develop and maintain up-to-date ‘fact-based’ customer development plans  Analyze marketing insights to unlock opportunities for future growth at prospects and accounts  Active use of Salesforce CRM  Establish and maintain professional relationships within ADM business units  Wholly responsible for contracting activities  Ultimately responsible for effective management of cost levers (knowing the cost to serve) and in assisting in the timely collection of account receivables Qualifications/Requirements  Bachelor’s degree in Science, Marketing, Business or related field and a minimum of 5 years of Industrial Sales experience  New business development mindset and approach to prospecting in the marketplace  Robust consultative selling, negotiation and presentation skills  Excellent written and oral communication skills  Strong planning and organizational skills with specific competency in prospecting, account planning and goal setting  Proactive and result-oriented  Good computer skills and knowledge of Microsoft software including Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint and Word  Strong Salesforce skills to drive sales opportunity pipeline and account plans 

 Travel 

 Overnight travel is required (40% minimum) 

 This position is remote based. Ideal candidate will be based near major airport, as prospecting will require travel across North America. 

Excited about this role but don’t meet every requirement listed? Studies show that often applicants will self-select out if they don’t check every box. We encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this role or another one of our openings.

ADM requires the successful completion of a background check.

REF:83578BR

Benefits And Perks

Enriching the quality of life for the world begins by taking care of our colleagues. In addition to competitive pay, we support your diverse needs with a comprehensive total rewards package to enhance your well-being, including:

Physical wellness – medical/Rx, dental, vision and on-site wellness center access or gym reimbursement (as applicable).Financial wellness – flexible spending accounts, health savings account, 401(k) with matching contributions and cash balance plan, discounted employee stock purchasing program, life insurance, disability, workers’ compensation, legal assistance, identity theft protection.Mental and social wellness – Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and Colleague Giving Programs (ADM Cares).

Additional Benefits Include

Paid time off including paid holidays.Adoption assistance and paid maternity and parental leave.Tuition assistance.Company-sponsored training and development resources, such as LinkedIn Learning, language training and mentoring programs.

*Benefits may vary for bargained locations, confirm benefit eligibility with your recruiter.

#IncludingYou

Diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging are cornerstones of ADM’s efforts to continue innovating, driving growth, and delivering outstanding performance. We are committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce and create welcoming, truly inclusive work environments — environments that enable every ADM colleague to feel comfortable on the job, make meaningful contributions to our success, and grow their career. We respect and value the unique backgrounds and experiences that each person can bring to ADM because we know that diversity of perspectives makes us better, together.

We are committed to ensuring all qualified applicants receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, ethnicity, disability, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, sexual orientation, age, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We welcome everyone to apply, especially those individuals who are underrepresented in our industry, as we strive to ensure our workforce represents the world that we help to feed: people of color, women, gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities. For more information regarding our efforts to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging, please visit our website here: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion | ADM.

About ADM

At ADM, we unlock the power of nature to provide access to nutrition worldwide. With industry-advancing innovations, a complete portfolio of ingredients and solutions to meet any taste, and a commitment to sustainability, we give customers an edge in solving the nutritional challenges of today and tomorrow. We’re a global leader in human and animal nutrition and the world’s premier agricultural origination and processing company. Our breadth, depth, insights, facilities and logistical expertise give us unparalleled capabilities to meet needs for food, beverages, health and wellness, and more. From the seed of the idea to the outcome of the solution, we enrich the quality of life the world over. Learn more at www.adm.com.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
